laboratory_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echotexture without focal lesion. Intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation is normal. The common bile duct is normal measuring 4 mm. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. The gallbladder is distended with sludge and possible intraluminal non-shadowing stones with mural thickening. There is no pericholecystic fluid or sonographic sign to suggest complications. The pancreas is not well seen due to overlying bowel gas. The imaged IVC is unremarkable. Trace amount of perihepatic free fluid is noted.
NO ANAEROBES ISOLATED. The measured value is 0.3 mg/dL, which is at the upper limit of the reference range (0.0 - 0.3).
